About Research Blog CV

Soham Phade




I am a final-year PhD student in the EECS Department at UC Berkeley, advised by Prof. Venkat Anantharam. I am a part of the BLISS lab, and I used to sit in Cory 264 before our world became fully online! You can reach me at:

Email: soham underscore phade at berkeley dot edu

I am broadly interested in problems at the intersection of game theory, networks, and economics. My current research focus is on the incentive-centered design of market-based mechanisms and algorithms for increasing social welfare. I am particularly interested in the role of behavioral models from psychology and decision theory (such as Cumulative Prospect Theory) in building efficient commercial systems that interact with humans. For more, see my post on Behavior-Aware System Design.

In Summer 2019, I interned as an Applied Scientist at Amazon Search Science and AI. I was a part of team MIDAS lead by Inderjit Dhillon.

Before joining UC Berkeley, I graduated from the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay with a B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering with Honors and a Minor in Computer Science and Engineering.

Here is my curriculum vitae.
